images.caption: Figure 2:ImageNet-256 Results.Our base model, xAR-B, outperforms DiT-XL[36]and SiT-XL[3]while achieving 20×\times×faster inference, and our largest model, xAR-H, establishes a new state-of-the-art with an FID of 1.24 on ImageNet-256.

Figure 3:Conditioning Mechanism Comparison between Vanilla ARvs.xAR.During training, vanilla AR conditions on all preceding ground truth tokens (i.e., Teacher Forcing), whereas xAR conditions on all previous noisy entities, each with different noises (i.e., Noisy Context Learning).
At inference, vanilla AR suffers from exposure bias, as errors accumulate over AR steps due to its exclusive training on ground truth tokens, leaving it unprepared for imperfect predictions. In contrast, xAR, trained to handle noisy inputs, reduces reliance on ground truth signals and improves robustness to prediction errors.
